strategy: Replace the random forest ensemble with a gradient-boosted tree model (e.g., XGBoost or LightGBM) using a deeper tree structure (max_depth = 8), apply target encoding with alpha = 0.3 to reduce variance, and introduce recursive feature elimination (RFE) with cross-validation to select top 50 features based on model performance. Use a learning rate of 0.01 and enable early stopping on R² validation to improve generalization. This strategy shifts from ensemble averaging to deeper, more expressive trees with aggressive feature selection.
